subject: RE: how to use ExceptionTestCase ?
msgSnippet: I am astonished what my simple question brought up... ... after rethinking it I totally agree. The code tells explicitly what the test is up to test. ... IMO
messageBody:
I am astonished what my simple question brought up...


> From: "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@...>
>
> To me, the second piece of code explicitely communicates that I want to
> assert the code in the block to throw an exception, whereas the first
> doesn't. It also seems to much better align with the other Junit assert
> idioms.


after rethinking it I totally agree. The code tells explicitly what the test
is up to test.


>>>> > public void testForException() {
>>>> > assertThrows(MyException.class, new Block() {
>>>> > public void execute() throws Exception {
>>>> > doSomethingThatShouldThrowMyException();
>>>> > }
>>>> > });
>>>> > }


IMO it should find its way in a future release of junit (at least
assertThrows) and the current ExceptionTestCase should be deprecated.

- Lucas
